title: 114_s2728
content: The Act may be cited as the "Alaska Native Access Card Act" and defines Alaska Native. The Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 is amended to redefine the term "Alaska Native" and make various other changes to existing paragraphs. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act redefines the term "Alaska Native" to include Tsimishian Indians, regardless of enrollment in the Metlakatla Indian Community. Conforming amendments to the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 replace "Indian, Aleut, or Eskimo" with "Alaska Native" in relevant sections. The Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 is amended to replace "Indian, Aleut, or Eskimo" with "Alaska Native" in relevant sections. The Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 is amended to replace references to "Alaskan Natives" with "Alaska Natives" in specific sections. SEC. 3. ALASKA NATIVE ACCESS CARDS. Section 101(a)(6) of the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 is amended to allow Alaska Natives with an Alaska Native Access Card to import marine mammals into the United States for noncommercial purposes. Additionally, the establishment of Alaska Native Access Cards is required within 90 days of the enactment of the law. The Secretary will issue an 'Alaska Native Access Card' to Alaska Natives allowing them to import marine mammal products within 30 days of receiving an application.
